snippet: Researchers reported that the greater wax moth can sense sound frequencies of up to 300 kilohertz, about 140 kilohertz more than dolphins, known for their keen sense of hearing.
abstract: Study in journal Biology Letters reports that greater wax moth has keenest hearing in world, with ability to sense frequencies of up to 300 kilohertz.
lead_paragraph: Researchers reported that the greater wax moth can sense sound frequencies of up to 300 kilohertz, about 140 kilohertz more than dolphins, known for their keen sense of hearing.

headline.seo: Greater Wax Moth Has World’s Most Extreme Hearing
headline.main: Hearing of Moths Surpasses All Others
headline.print_headline: Audiology: Hearing of Moths Surpasses All Others
